body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug


**What happened**:

The deployment controller for a `strategy: Recreate` deployment with a single replica failed to create a new ReplicaSet when the old ReplicaSet included an Evicted pod. Typically, the eviction was caused by "node low on resource: nodefs". When we manually deleted the evicted pod, the new RS and accompanying pod were created immediately. We have seen this happen at least a dozen times. Here are the audit logs for a recent case:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4789493/36509901-26d93d38-172f-11e8-9062-084bfc202afa.png)


**What you expected to happen**:

The deployment controller ignores the evicted pod and creates the updated replicaset/pod.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

To reproduce, you would need a way to trigger a kubelet-driven eviction on a node that is currently running a single-replica Deployment with  `strategy: Recreate`. Wait for the pod to be evicted and the new pod to be created, confirm that the evicted pod still exists, and then make a trivial change to the deployment spec. The running pod will be deleted, and no new replicaset/pod will be created. 

This issue does not seem to occur for manual evictions (via `POST /eviction`); pods I evict that way disappear from the API server immediately.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

Possibly related to https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/54525 and/or https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/55630

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):  v1.8.5-gke.0
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: GKE
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Container-Optimized OS

title: Deployment controller fails to create new RS when old RS has an evicted pod
